content.thinking: Let me analyze this Colombian Final Beneficiaries Report (RUB) issued by DIAN. From the first page, I can identify: - This is a "Reporte de Beneficiarios Finales" (Final Beneficiaries Report) from DIAN - Form number: 2687 - Company name: "NECONSER SAS" (cell 11. Denominación o razón social) - Tax ID: "901355130" (cell 18. Número de identificación with DV "1") - Country: Colombia (this is a DIAN document) - Identification type: Should be "NIT" for Colombian companies Now I need to extract the beneficiaries information from pages 2 and 3: Page 2 shows the first two beneficiaries: First beneficiary: - Document type: "13" (cell 29) - ID Number: "1022418631" (cell 30) - First names: "GERALDINE" (cell 36) - Last names: "HERNANDEZ DIAZ" (cells 34 and 35) - Participation percentage: "35" (cell 57) - Novelty type: "Actualización" with code "2" (cell 61) Second beneficiary: - Document type: "13" (cell 29) - ID Number: "1022369773" (cell 30) - First names: "ERIKA YESSENIA" (cells 36 and 37) - Last names: "GUERRA QUIÑONES" (cells 34 and 35) - Participation percentage: "60" (cell 57) - Novelty type: "Actualización" with code "2" (cell 61) Page 3 shows a third beneficiary: - Document type: "13" (cell 29) - ID Number: "1018416174" (cell 30) - First names: "CARLOS ANDRES" (cells 36 and 37) - Last names: "GUERRA QUIÑONES" (cells 34 and 35) - Participation percentage: "5" (cell 57) - Novelty type: "Actualización" with code "2" (cell 61) I've confirmed the participation percentages perfectly total 100%. The document follows standard identification protocols for Colombian business reporting. Despite the typical document type referencing a citizen ID, DIAN regulations mandate using "NIT" for Final Beneficiaries Reports, which this submission correctly implements.
